intro: Altamiranoa berillonana, commonly known as the Altamiranoa berillonana, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique floral structure and leaf morphology. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in tropical or subtropical regions. Its botanical features include showy, pentagonal flowers and palmate leaves, which contribute to its ornamental value. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
